Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration. The rear shows a slightly concave surface with wood impression, probably from a bolt or knob. One impression of a turned cord with a width of 0.2cm is impressed in the break. The upper side is roughly flat with one lateral side slightly bending downwards and showing finger imprints. The lower part of an impression of an oval scarab-like seal is visible. Recognisable are three standing figures holding each others hands, probably gods and pharaoh. The heads are not preserved.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
